title: How to Make Ginger Garlic Tea

steps.headline: Slice the garlic and ginger into 1/8" slices.
steps.description: When you're done slicing you should have 1–1 1/2 tablespoons of garlic, and 2–3 tablespoons of ginger. Add to your cup.

steps.headline: Pour a couple tablespoons of honey over the garlic and ginger.
steps.description: Add more if you prefer sweeter tea.

steps.headline: Add a slice of lemon or lime, or some lemon or lime juice, to your cup.
steps.description: This is optional, but does add a nice flavor.

steps.headline: Pour the boiling water into your cup and let sit for a few minutes.
steps.description: You don't have to worry about over-brewing the tea, but it will need to cool down before you drink it. If your throat is sore, now is a great time to position your head over the tea and inhale the steam. This will increase circulation to your throat and sinus, therefore helping to make them heal quicker.

steps.headline: Enjoy your tea!
steps.description: Have it up to three times a day for very sore throats, and reuse the sliced ginger and garlic up to three times before slicing more.
